p.s: my Namename is Faraj al-Byarshan, I'm 41 years old and in year 2005 I immigrated to New York from Iraq.

Today I would like to describe my experiences of immigrating to New York also including my family situation, my reasons for immigration, the positive and negative experiences and my hopes for the future.
First of all, when I immigrated to New York in year 2005 my wife and my two sons were still in Iraq.
When they immigrated it was year 2007, so I was here, two years without my family not knowing how they are going or if they are still alive.
When they came here I was verryvery happy, that they made it and today we are a better team, than before everything we need to deal with made us stronger, than we have ever been.
I immigrated to New York with the hope to have a better life here, with better living conditions, a better work for me and my wife and a better education for my two sons.
I would like my sons to reach more than I did so I try to faciliate everything I can for them.
I don't wanted my sons to grew up in the Iraq so I needed to do something and that's why I came to the conclusion to immigrate to New York.
Of course, such an immigration deals with positive and negative experiences, but all that was worth it, when I see, what I have for a beautiful life now.
First I needed to experience, that it isn't easy to come across the border, it was a hard way for me and I tried it more than one time.
Second I coudcould have died during, but I didn't so I don't overthink that anymore.

But on the other side, there are also positive aspects, I wasn't alone during this whole experience, we were a big group trying to cross the border and it makes me very happy to see how many of them reach and finally cross the border.
Weighting these aspects I would always decide by trying and not by giving up.
You need to see, what you can reach if you try your best and that the life you can lifelive in for example: New York is so much better than the life in the Iraq.
For the future, I hope, that I can always lifelive here in New York and that many people from countryscountries with wars can reach the border to a better life.
Once you are here your life just gets better and easier and not worser and more difficult so believe in yourself and have a better life.
It was the best decision, I have ever made to immigrate to New York with my family and I'm thankfullthankful for everything they do here for immigrants.
Thank you everybody for letting me telling you my story and may motivate others to immigrate.
